summary: Millions of homeowners defaulted on their mortgages during the 2007-2009 financial crisis. Institutional investors—companies that own a lot of single-family rental homes—bought many of these foreclosed homes in bulk and converted them into rental housing, especially in states across the southern U.S. Researchers found that institutional investors may have contributed to increasing home prices and rents following the financial crisis. However, it's unclear how these...
title: Rental Housing: Information on Institutional Investment in Single-Family Homes
